intro: Streptanthus glandulosus subsp. josephinensis, commonly known as the Josephine's bladderpod, is a flowering plant native to California. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family, which includes mustard plants, and is characterized by its small, showy flowers that are typically white or pale yellow. The subspecies is distinguished by its glandular leaves and a unique floral structure that sets it apart from other members of the species. It thrives in rocky or open habitats and is often found in coastal regions. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endangered plant in its native range.
